note: co-produced A New Index of Middle English Verse (British Library, 2005), and recently published a study of Manuscript and Print in London 1475–1530 (British Library, 2012). She has also published articles on Middle English lyrics, on fourteenth- and fifteenth-century verse and verse translation, on women’s literacy and reading in the Middle Ages, and on early printing in England.
title: Her research mostly deals with aspects of the transmission and reception of literary texts ca
She has edited a collection of Fifteenth-Century English Dream Visions

note: A graduate of the University of Sydney, in 2010–2011 she
title: Stephanie Downes has published on French and English texts and manuscripts from the later Middle Ages and their reception up to the present day

note: and she has authored a number of articles on medieval English literature and on the history of emotions.
title: focused on the works of fifteenth-century England’s greatest poet. With Katie Walter, she also co-edited The Culture of Inquisition in Medieval England

note: Edition (Heidelberg: Universit ätsverlag Winter) was published in early 2013, and she is co-editor of the essay collection Readings on Audience and Textual Materiality (Pickering & Chatto, 2011). Her monograph on practical texts will come out with Ashgate in 2016, and she has published widely on manuscript and book history.
title: Carrie Griffin is Lecturer in Early Modern Literature at the University of Limerick and Research Associate of the English Department, University of Bristol. She was Irish Research Council Marie Curie Research Fellow (2010–13) at Queen Mary, University of London, and National University of Ireland Fellow (2007–09) at University College Cork, Ireland. Her first monograph, The Middle English Wise Book of Philosophy and Astronomy: A Parallel-Text

note: and Correcting, Craft and Literary Criticism: English Manuscripts 1375–1510 (forthcoming).
title: Palaeography at the University of Oxford, and Executive Secretary of the Early English Text Society. He is co-editor with Alexandra Gillespie of The Production of Books in England 1350–1500 (2011) and author of Humanism, Reading and English Literature 1430–1530

note: and has authored articles on medieval literary theory, the body, and interiority. She is currently completing a monograph on the mouth in medieval traditions.
title: Walter is Lecturer in Medieval English Literature at the University of Sussex. She is the editor of two essay collections, Reading Skin in Medieval Literature and Culture
